00020 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00021 #include "copynumber/CNSmoother.h"
00022 //
00023 
00024 // Any copy number segments shorter than m_min_length are replace with
00025 // values conforming to their neighbors
00026 
00027 using namespace std;
00028 
00029 // need to do initialize a class variable in a cpp file
00030 int CNSmootherSegment::m_min_length = CNSMOOTHER_SEGMENT_LENGTH;
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 // if a segment at least minimum length and so are its neighbors its
00035 // membership of markers will be fixed
00036 bool CNSmootherSegment::fixed() const
00037     {
00038     if (m_segment->size < m_min_length) return false;
00039     if (m_segment->prev) if (m_segment->prev->size < m_min_length) return false;
00040     if (m_segment->next) if (m_segment->next->size < m_min_length) return false;
00041     return true;
00042     }
00043 
00044 
00045 // expansion of a segment consists of taking a marker from any neighbor
00046 // with fewer than the minimum number of markers
00047 void CNSmootherSegment::expand()
00048     {
00049     // these will do nothing in the cases that neighbor has enough markers
00050     take_from_prev();
00051     take_from_next();
00052     }
00053 
00054 
00055 //  Take a marker from the previous member in the doubly linked list.
00056 void CNSmootherSegment::take_from_prev()
00057     {
00058     // If this is the beginning of the list do nothing
00059     if (!m_segment->prev) return;
00060 
00061     // If the previous member is of minimum size do nothing
00062     if (m_segment->prev->size >= m_min_length) return;
00063 
00064     // Push the start back one and add to the marker count
00065     m_segment->position -= 1;
00066     m_segment->size += 1;
00067 
00068     // The previous segment has one marker fewer
00069     m_segment->prev->size -= 1;
00070 
00071     // Check to see the previous segment has at least one member
00072     if (m_segment->prev->size) return;
00073 
00074     // Otherwise the previous segment empty so skip it for a neighbor
00075     m_segment->prev = m_segment->prev->prev;
00076 
00077     // If the new neighbor is not the terminus make the skip reciprocal
00078     if (m_segment->prev) m_segment->prev->next = m_segment;
00079     }
00080 
00081 
00082 // Exact same as take_from_prev but instead looking at the segment following
00083 void CNSmootherSegment::take_from_next()
00084     {
00085     // If this is the end of the list do nothing
00086     if (!m_segment->next) return;
00087 
00088     // If the following member is of minimum size do nothing
00089     if (m_segment->next->size >= m_min_length) return;
00090 
00091     // Add to the marker count
00092     m_segment->size += 1;
00093 
00094     // Push the start of the following segment ahead one marker
00095     m_segment->next->position += 1;
00096 
00097     // The following segment has one marker fewer
00098     m_segment->next->size -= 1;
00099 
00100     // Check to see the previous segment has at least one member
00101     if (m_segment->next->size) return;
00102 
00103     // Otherwise the following segment empty so skip it for a neighbor
00104     m_segment->next = m_segment->next->next;
00105 
00106     // If the new neighbor is not the terminus make the skip reciprocal
00107     if (m_segment->next) m_segment->next->prev = m_segment;
00108     }
00109 
00110 
00111 // This does all the work.  Values is a list of copy numbers that gets
00112 // summarized by segments.  Short segments are then consumed by their
00113 // larger neighbors one marker at a time from their ends.  This is
00114 // accomplished by markers at the end of short segments to neighboring
00115 // larger segments.
00116 void CNSmoother::smooth(valarray<int> & values)
00117     {
00118     // If the list of marker values is empty do nothing.
00119     if (!values.size()) return;
00120 
00121     // values is summarised as segments here
00122     vector<segment_info_t> stored_segments;
00123 
00124     // Initialize the first segment
00125     int start=0;               // the start position of the segment
00126     int seg_value=values[0];   // the segment copy number value
00127 
00128     // Assemble the segments one marker at a time
00129     for (unsigned int end=1; end<values.size(); end++)
00130         {
00131         // roll along until copy number changes
00132         if (values[end] == seg_value) continue;
00133 
00134         // something changed so push back the segment
00135         segment_info_t segment(start, end - start, seg_value);
00136         stored_segments.push_back(segment);
00137 
00138         // one past the end is becomes the start of an empty segment
00139         start = end;
00140         seg_value = values[start];
00141         }
00142 
00143     // Close up the last segment and push it back on the list
00144     segment_info_t segment(start,values.size() - start,seg_value);
00145     stored_segments.push_back(segment);
00146 
00147 
00148     // Initial segments are all in a row.  Need them in a double linked list
00149     vector<CNSmootherSegment> cns_vec(stored_segments.size());
00150 
00151     // Initialize the values in the doubly linked list
00152     for (unsigned int i=0; i<stored_segments.size(); i++)
00153         {
00154         cns_vec[i] = CNSmootherSegment(&stored_segments[i]);
00155         }
00156 
00157     // Hook up the reciprocal links in the list
00158     for (unsigned int i=1; i<stored_segments.size(); i++)
00159         {
00160         cns_vec[i].set_prev(&stored_segments[i-1]);
00161         cns_vec[i-1].set_next(&stored_segments[i]);
00162         }
00163 
00164     // Order them largest to smallest.  This does not affect linkage
00165     sort(cns_vec.begin(),cns_vec.end(),segment_sort_size());
00166 
00167     // A queue of segments that are not fixed.
00168     queue<CNSmootherSegment>cns_queue;
00169 
00170     // Load the queue with segments that are larger than the minimum size
00171     // but also have at least one neighbor that is shorter than minimum size
00172     for (vector<CNSmootherSegment>::reverse_iterator iter=cns_vec.rbegin();
00173             iter != cns_vec.rend(); iter++)
00174         {
00175         // Because of the sorting the first segment found too short signals
00176         // that so too are all remaining segments
00177         if (iter->too_short()) break;
00178 
00179         // Anything segment with no neighbors to acquire markers from does
00180         // not belong in the queue
00181         if (iter->fixed()) continue;
00182 
00183         // Otherwise push it back
00184         cns_queue.push(*iter);
00185         }
00186 
00187     // Done when the queue is empty
00188     while (cns_queue.size())
00189         {
00190         // If its neighbors are all of minimum size toss it from the queue
00191         if (cns_queue.front().fixed())
00192             {
00193             cns_queue.pop();
00194             continue;
00195             }
00196 
00197         // Otherwise acquire a marker from any neighbor with fewer markers
00198         // than the minimum.
00199         cns_queue.front().expand();
00200 
00201         // Put it at the back of the queue.
00202         cns_queue.push(cns_queue.front());
00203         cns_queue.pop();
00204         }
00205 
00206 
00207     // The doubly linked list of segments has been maintained.  The starts
00208     // and lengths of segments has changed so that they all have the minimum
00209     // number of markers.  Any segments starting with fewer than the
00210     // minimum numbers of markers are now empty with a marker count of zero.
00211     // Overwrite the input copy numbers.
00212     for (unsigned int i=0; i<stored_segments.size(); i++)
00213         {
00214         if (!stored_segments[i].size) continue;
00215         int pos = stored_segments[i].position;
00216         unsigned int size = stored_segments[i].size;
00217         unsigned int value = stored_segments[i].value;
00218         for (unsigned int j=0; j<size; j++) values[pos + j] = value;
00219         }
00220     }
Generated on Wed Mar 23 2016 12:58:58 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
